page.title: 16HISTORICAL REMAINS,KIRKCALDY
page.content: {SEAFIELD TOWER :}The ruin of Seafield Tower stands on the beach just south of Kirkcaldy. It is a square tower whose walls are 1.65 metres thick. It had a wheel stair, and was surrounded by a fosse moat. The tower was the home of the Moultray family, the last of whom was killed in 1715. {PITEADIE CASTLE :}The castle was a square keep and dates from the mid 16th. century. It was the home of William Calderwood of Piteadie, an apothecary to the people of Edinburgh. {STANDING STANES}: These 2 stones stand 19ft. apart in a field to the north of the Jawbanes Road. Their origin is uncertain, but they may be graves or the remains of a Druidical temple. They are quadrilateral boulders, facing due east-west, the one to the east being of whinstone and the other of a quartz grained material.
